title: 'Old Town Road' becomes the second country single to reach top-selling Diamond status
text:
CLOSE

CLOSE Lil Nas X, the artist behind "Old Town Road," came out as gay in a new song titled "c7osure." The rapper confirmed the news on his Twitter account. USA TODAY

Just when Lil Nas X's ride down the "Old Town Road" started to slow, the song galloped to another remarkable sales record.

The monster summer hit reached Diamond status Tuesday, per the Recording Industry Association of America. Moving 10 million certified units (streaming and sales combined), it's the fastest song in RIAA history to reach the milestone, Billboard reported.

It's the first song of 2019 to reach Diamond status.

And it's only the second single labeled "country" (a point of contention in popular culture earlier this year) to reach the sales milestone — joining Florida Georgia Line megahit "Cruise."

More:After being booted off country charts, 'Old Town Road' heads to the CMA Awards

Lil Nas X, right, and Billy Ray Cyrus perform the huge hit, "Old Town Road," at the Spotify House at Ole Red in Nashville June 7, 2019. (Photo: Andrew Nelles / Tennessean.com)

Two country artists — Taylor Swift and Garth Brooks — have earned Diamond album certifications, for "Fearless" and "The Ultimate Hits," respectively.

Lil Nas X and "Old Town Road" collaborator Billy Ray Cyrus made history in July when the song became the longest-running No. 1 single in Billboard Hot 100 history. Backed by a handful of remixes, the song spent 19 weeks topping the chart.

More: Lil Nas X, Billy Ray Cyrus applaud Billie Eilish for ending 'Old Town Road's historic run

"Old Town Road" punched a ticket earlier this year to the 53rd CMA Awards by earning a nomination for "Musical Event of the Year." The annual award show takes place Nov. 13 at Bridgestone Arena.
